article_title: Police issue multiple summonses for theft
article_text:
STERLING POLICE DEPARTMENT

At 11:50 p.m. Erica Nicole Weber, 32, of Holyoke, was issued a municipal summons, at 700 Broadway St., for theft regarding an incident that occurred at Dairy Queen on July 14.

At 12:25 a.m. Paul Arden Jones, of Sterling, was arrested in the 700 block of S. Second Ave., on charges of criminal mischief - less than $300, harassing shoves/strikes/kicks and domestic violence.

At 9:50 p.m. Lane Wacey Sharp, 19, of Sterling, was issued a summons, while at Sterling Regional MedCenter, for underage possession and consumption of alcohol.

At 6:17 p.m. Sandra Jean Gardner, of Sterling, reported forgery and theft of $50 to $300, at 406 Beattie St.

At 6:50 p.m. Melvin Rodney Jackson, 47, of Sterling, was issued a summons at Wal-Mart, 1510 W. Main St., for theft of a watch.

At 7:50 p.m. Amber Kay Makinster, 31, of Sterling, was issued a summons, at 715 Douglas St., for theft.
